intro: Calytrix calingiri, commonly known as the pink-flowered honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers attract nectar-feeding insects and birds, contributing to its ecological significance. Calytrix calingiri is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
